com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.mvc

Interface ViewModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultViewModel

    public interface ViewModel
    A ViewModel represents a particular view that should be rendered as well as the data model that will be used (if any) when rendering the view.

    Redirects

    Redirects are a little special: if isRedirect() is true, an actual view won't be rendered. Instead an HTTP 302 redirect will be sent in the response to indicate that a different view should be rendered.

    Since:
    1.0.RC4

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Map<String,?> getModel()
      Returns the model used when rendering the view page template or null if there is no model to render.
      String getViewName()
      If isRedirect() is false, this method returns the logical name of the view (e.g.
      boolean isForward()
      Returns true if the viewName is a named internal resource that should not be rendered by the handler, but instead the handler must dispatch the request and forward it to the internal resource instead.
      boolean isRedirect()
      Returns true if the ViewModel instance indicates an HTTP redirect should be returned instead of rendering an actual page template, false if a page template should be rendered using the associated model.

    • Method Detail

      • getViewName

        String getViewName()
        If isRedirect() is false, this method returns the logical name of the view (e.g. page template) to be rendered. If isRedirect() is true, the return value is a context-relative URI to where the user will be redirected.
        Returns:
        A logical name of the view to be rendered, or, if isRedirect(), the context-relative URI to where the user will be redirected.

      • isRedirect

        boolean isRedirect()
        Returns true if the ViewModel instance indicates an HTTP redirect should be returned instead of rendering an actual page template, false if a page template should be rendered using the associated model.
        Returns:
        true if the ViewModel instance indicates an HTTP redirect should be returned instead of rendering an actual page template, false if a page template should be rendered using the associated model.

      • isForward

        boolean isForward()
        Returns true if the viewName is a named internal resource that should not be rendered by the handler, but instead the handler must dispatch the request and forward it to the internal resource instead. That is, a true value mostly enables to the following behavior: 
        
 String viewName = getViewName();
 request.getRequestDispatcher(viewName).forward(request, response);
        false is returned if the view is either a redirect or should be rendered by the handler.
        Returns:
        true if the viewName is a named internal resource that should not be rendered by the handler, but instead the handler must dispatch the request and forward it to the internal resource instead.

      • getModel

        Map<String,?> getModel()
        Returns the model used when rendering the view page template or null if there is no model to render.
        Returns:
        the model used when rendering the view page template or null if there is no model to render.
